pullRequest.body:
In this PR, we construct various pseudofunctors which send a (commutative) ring to its category of modules. Depending on the case, the functoriality is given by the restriction of scalars or by the extension of scalars.

---

- [x] depends on: #18201 


<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

> This all looks good to me, the only problem is that there are a lot of `erw`s. I looked into this (see [zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/need.20.60erw.60.20due.20to.20type.20not.20being.20.60dsimpNF.60)), and I think all but one of your `erw`s (the `comp_apply` one) would not be necessary if there was a `dsimp%` elaborator. Then, instead of `erw [lemma]` you would type `rw [dsimp% lemma]`. Making such an elaborator should be very easy (if it does not already exist), and I might have time to do this on Sunday if you can wait for that. But I am happy to have this merged also. I also left some small comments that are more like questions and do not need fixing.

Is this related to the feature I suggested at https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/attribute.20simp_NF_my_lemma.3F/near/443101462

This all looks good to me, the only problem is that there are a lot of `erw`s. I looked into this (see [zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/need.20.60erw.60.20due.20to.20type.20not.20being.20.60dsimpNF.60)), and I think all but one of your `erw`s (the `comp_apply` one) would not be necessary if there was a `dsimp%` elaborator. Then, instead of `erw [lemma]` you would type `rw [dsimp% lemma]`. Making such an elaborator should be very easy (if it does not already exist), and I might have time to do this on Sunday if you can wait for that. But I am happy to have this merged also. I also left some small comments that are more like questions and do not need fixing.
Why does this require `by exact ...` in the statement? I see that it can't seem to synthesize `Module R M` without it, which seems weird.
I have fixed this by using the notation `(1 : S) âŠ—â‚œ[R,f] m` which specify how to get the module structure.

I didn't think of this before, but you having to write this lemma makes me think that `mapâ‚‚_associator` for `Pseudofunctor` should not be written in that form, but rather like `extendScalars_assoc`. But that is besides this PR.
If you don't, I might make a follow-up PR to refactor that at some point, but I am quite busy nowadays for a bit.
Is this to make the code faster, or is this `have` statement useful?
(note also that if it is for efficiency purposes, it would be unecessary once there is a `dsimp%` elaborator as I mentioned in the main comment)

pullRequest.title: feat(Algebra/Category/ModuleCat): the pseudofunctors which send a ring to its category of modules

source.title: feat(Algebra/Category/ModuleCat/Presheaf): the endofunctor of presheaves of modules induced by an oplax natural transformation
feat(Algebra/Category/ModuleCat/Presheaf): exterior powers of presheaves of modules

nodes.body: This all looks good to me, the only problem is that there are a lot of `erw`s. I looked into this (see [zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/need.20.60erw.60.20due.20to.20type.20not.20being.20.60dsimpNF.60)), and I think all but one of your `erw`s (the `comp_apply` one) would not be necessary if there was a `dsimp%` elaborator. Then, instead of `erw [lemma]` you would type `rw [dsimp% lemma]`. Making such an elaborator should be very easy (if it does not already exist), and I might have time to do this on Sunday if you can wait for that. But I am happy to have this merged also. I also left some small comments that are more like questions and do not need fixing.
